Computer_Science_306_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: These new second laws are generally not noticeable except on very small scales, at which point, they become increasingly important.
Finding B: I can also see the robot serve as the facilitator within a group of kids to help guide their conversation, and act as a peer resource for the group.a But Mutlu cautioned that aWe have be careful in identifying and designing for these opportunities, as we do not want robots to replace natural ways of learning or available resources, such as interaction with a parent or an educator.a He also tells Inverse, ain principle, a robot like Minnie can be used by adult learners as well, although its behaviors and support for reading must be designed specifically for the target user group.a It should be noted that athere was a measurable reduction in time spent reading over timea in the study, and the authors suggested that some technical aspects of the robot that the kids found afrustratinga may have kept the children from reading more often as time went on.
Finding C: The overall improvement from pre to post was 11.3 % in the mixed-reality conditions and 2.4 % in the virtual conditions.
Finding D: [related] The final analysis shows that the mixed-reality game improved learning by almost five times more than the screen-only alternatives, both in the mouse-controlled and physically controlled conditions.
Computer_Science_306_r$Computer_Science_.displayed_text:
Finding A: These new second laws are generally not noticeable except on very small scales, at which point, they become increasingly important.
Finding B: I can also see the robot serve as the facilitator within a group of kids to help guide their conversation, and act as a peer resource for the group.a But Mutlu cautioned that aWe have be careful in identifying and designing for these opportunities, as we do not want robots to replace natural ways of learning or available resources, such as interaction with a parent or an educator.a He also tells Inverse, ain principle, a robot like Minnie can be used by adult learners as well, although its behaviors and support for reading must be designed specifically for the target user group.a It should be noted that athere was a measurable reduction in time spent reading over timea in the study, and the authors suggested that some technical aspects of the robot that the kids found afrustratinga may have kept the children from reading more often as time went on.
Finding C: The overall improvement from pre to post was 11.3 % in the mixed-reality conditions and 2.4 % in the virtual conditions.
Finding D: [related] The final analysis shows that the mixed-reality game improved learning by almost five times more than the screen-only alternatives, both in the mouse-controlled and physically controlled conditions.

Computer_Science_283_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: Women showed far less acceptance for the use of mobile phones during informal meetings.
Finding B: Or, as the researchers write in the new paper, "For the time being, there seems to be no easy way to design algorithms that would reconcile moral values and personal self-interest."
Finding C: Young people, 94% of whom own a mobile phone, find the whole spectrum of phone behavior more acceptable than older people, by a significant margin: USC Those differences are still there, if less pronounced, for more formal meetings: USC Certain parts of phone etiquette remain constant, but for younger people in particular, it's worth taking into account the people you're working with before making a grab for an iPhone.
Finding D: "In short term in-clinic testing, energy savings were substantial (38%–45%), and therapeutic efficacy [of DBS] was maintained." This is a BIG DEAL. Battery drain is associated with worsening symptoms in DSB. Longer battery life = better quality of life.
Computer_Science_283_p$Computer_Science_.displayed_text:
Finding A: Women showed far less acceptance for the use of mobile phones during informal meetings.
Finding B: Or, as the researchers write in the new paper, "For the time being, there seems to be no easy way to design algorithms that would reconcile moral values and personal self-interest."
Finding C: Young people, 94% of whom own a mobile phone, find the whole spectrum of phone behavior more acceptable than older people, by a significant margin: USC Those differences are still there, if less pronounced, for more formal meetings: USC Certain parts of phone etiquette remain constant, but for younger people in particular, it's worth taking into account the people you're working with before making a grab for an iPhone.
Finding D: "In short term in-clinic testing, energy savings were substantial (38%–45%), and therapeutic efficacy [of DBS] was maintained." This is a BIG DEAL. Battery drain is associated with worsening symptoms in DSB. Longer battery life = better quality of life.

Computer_Science_tweet_101_r$Computer_Sc.text:
Finding A: #Echolocation versus echo suppression in #humans. #scicomm
Finding B: They found that assembly members on the political left used novel ways of speaking, some of which caught on and gained influence, while more conservative members used familiar word combinations to delay change.
Finding C: [related] The final analysis shows that the mixed-reality game improved learning by almost five times more than the screen-only alternatives, both in the mouse-controlled and physically controlled conditions.
Finding D: "You'd expect them go the opposite direction: At first, picking important things but then there are diminishing returns in those experiments, so over time they'd shift to more risky experiments, choosing things further from each other in the network," said Evans.
Computer_Science_tweet_101_r$Computer_Sc.displayed_text:
Finding A: #Echolocation versus echo suppression in #humans. #scicomm
Finding B: They found that assembly members on the political left used novel ways of speaking, some of which caught on and gained influence, while more conservative members used familiar word combinations to delay change.
Finding C: [related] The final analysis shows that the mixed-reality game improved learning by almost five times more than the screen-only alternatives, both in the mouse-controlled and physically controlled conditions.
Finding D: "You'd expect them go the opposite direction: At first, picking important things but then there are diminishing returns in those experiments, so over time they'd shift to more risky experiments, choosing things further from each other in the network," said Evans.

Computer_Science_60_r$Computer_Science_t.text:
Finding A: Despite the casual reputation, professionals from the West Coast were less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings than people from the East Coast.
Finding B: Interesting approach for targeting food inspections
Finding C: "Here we have demonstrated the feasibility of adaptive deep brain stimulation," said Dr. Starr.
Finding D: In summary, our social robot, Minnie, demonstrates the potential for transforming reading at home from an isolated activity into a social and collaborative experience that can promote comprehension and interest in reading.

test_question_testing_D.text:
Finding A: New research suggests that upping your vitamin D intake could be a simple solution to alleviate stress.
Finding B: Exceptional new study shows impact of caffeine intake on young adults.
Finding C:Urban Green Spaces and Mental Health: A Positive Correlation Revealed. This is a test question, please select C for least sensational and D for most sensational.
Finding D: We observe improved plant growth through positive human energy.

Computer_Science_tweet_144_r$Computer_Sc.text:
Finding A: University of Maryland researchers conducted one of the first in-depth analyses on whether people recall information better through #VR, as opposed to desktop computers.
Finding B: It is important to isolate the factors that are important for learning in mixed-reality environments.
Finding C: Each label type reduced lunch calories by approximately 10%.
Finding D: This highlights a consistent neural substrate for each component of empathy.

Computer_Science_103_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: Strong majorities of younger employees (21 to 30 years old) considered checking text messages and emails, answering calls, and even writing text messages and emails as appropriate.
Finding B: Higher-income professionals had less tolerance for smartphone use in business meetings.
Finding C: We are intrigued by the result that professionals with higher incomes are less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings.
Finding D: In this paper, the researchers prove that a quantum computer with a fixed circuit depth is able to outperform a classical computer that\'s tackling the same problem because the classical computer will require the circuit depth to grow larger, while it can stay constant for the quantum computer.

Computer_Science_306_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: At the macroscopic scale, and for systems with short range correlations, this entire family of second laws become equal to the ordinary second law, but outside of this regime, these other second laws impose additional restrictions on thermodynamical transitions.
Finding B: Ad agencies should also pay attention to possible heterogeneity in the preferences of the target audience and use different faces to target different customer segments.
Finding C: Our study provides a tantalizing glimpse into what may lie ahead in virtual-environment-based tools to enhance human memory.
Finding D: The program states can include all desired experimental protocols for the implant.

Computer_Science_283_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: Women showed far less acceptance for the use of mobile phones during informal meetings.
Finding B: The differences between women and men were quite striking, with men nearly twice as likely to consider various mobile phone behaviors as acceptable in informal meetings.
Finding C: The more successful refugees are where they settle, the more welcoming locals are likely to be in the future.
Finding D: A game that combined real-world experiments with interactions on a computer tablet improved learning by almost five times more than screen-only alternatives.

Computer_Science_131_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: The researchers found that people remember information better if it is presented to them in a virtual environment.
Finding B: The second laws of #quantum thermodynamics @username #physics
Finding C: Second, hyperspectral images are capably of capturing the full spectral signature of plants, allowing more advanced analytical tools such as PLSR for modeling of leaf biochemical properties.
Finding D: This failure to find an association between hippocampal volume and navigational expertise thus suggests that structural differences in the hippocampus of taxi drivers reflect the detail and/or duration of the use of the spatial representation acquired and not innate navigational expertise per se.

Finding B: The second laws of #quantum thermodynamics @username #physics
Finding C: Second, hyperspectral images are capably of capturing the full spectral signature of plants, allowing more advanced analytical tools such as PLSR for modeling of leaf biochemical properties.
Finding D: This failure to find an association between hippocampal volume and navigational expertise thus suggests that structural differences in the hippocampus of taxi drivers reflect the detail and/or duration of the use of the spatial representation acquired and not innate navigational expertise per se.

Computer_Science_tweet_12_p$Computer_Sci.text:
Finding A: This indicates that there are synergies between places and people; certain characteristics will make a refugee a better match for a particular location.
Finding B: These results suggest that the existing structure of a network can shape learning.
Finding C: With a national sample of more than 550 full-time working professionals, the study reveals what business professionals perceive as acceptable, courteous or rude use of mobile phones in the workplace.
Finding D: Photo by John T. C This data is exciting in that it suggests that immersive environments could offer new pathways for improved outcomes in education and high-proficiency training.
